intro: Hieracium crinifolium, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lobed, serrated leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium crinifolium is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it serves as a food source for various pollinators.
